KSPI Bakal Gelar Demo Tolak Kenaikan UMP DKI Jadi Rp 4,2 Juta
02 Nov 2019, 13:32 by Matius Alfons
Jakarta - Gubernur Anies Baswedan baru saja menentukan kenaikan upah minimum provinsi (UMP) sebesar 8,51 persen atau dari Rp 3.940.000 menjadi Rp 4.276.349. Konfederasi Serikat Pekerja Indonesia (KSPI) tidak sepakat dengan kenaikan tersebut.
"Yang pertama KSPI menolak kenaikan menjadi Rp 4,2 juta. Jadi KSPI tetap menuntut agar UMP DKI 2020 Rp 4,6 juta," kata Ketua Departemen Komunikasi dan Media KSPI Kahar S Cahyono saat dihubungi, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Kahar mengatakan tidak sependapat dengan kenaikan tersebut karena Anies berjanji menaikkan UMP lebih tinggi dari Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 78. Selain itu, kenaikan menjadi Rp 4,2 juta tidak sesuai dengan survei kebutuhan yang sudah mereka lakukan.
"Oh iya, terlalu kecil, karena perhitungan kami, mesti untuk upah minimum di DKI itu bisa Rp 4,6 juta. Nah, itu berdasarkan perhitungan kebutuhan hidup layak yang kami survei dengan 84 item," ucapnya.

KSPI Will Hold a Demo to Reject DKI's UMP Increase to Rp 4.2 Million
02 Nov 2019, 13:32 by Matthew Alfons
Jakarta - Governor Anies Baswedan has just set the provincial minimum wage (UMP) increase of 8.51 percent or from Rp 3,940,000 to Rp 4,276,349. The Confederation of Indonesian Trade Unions (KSPI) did not agree with the increase.
"The first KSPI rejected the increase to Rp 4.2 million. So KSPI still demanded that the 2020 Jakarta UMP be Rp 4.6 million," said Chairman of the KSPI Communication and Media Department Kahar S Cahyono when contacted on Saturday (11/02/2019).
Kahar said he disagreed with the increase because Anies promised to raise the UMP higher than Government Regulation Number 78. In addition, the increase to Rp 4.2 million was not in accordance with the survey of needs they had done.
"Oh yes, it is too small, because of our calculations, the minimum wage in DKI should be Rp. 4.6 million. Well, it is based on the calculation of decent living needs that we surveyed with 84 items," he said.
